page.title: 19Education.
page.content: History of the School. The original school was built on the site of the old Tithe Barn and pond, by the Rev. James Michael of Whatcombe House and formally Vicar of Sturminster Newton. He married a Pleydell, heiress of the Moreton Pleydells. On the wall of the school was a tablet stating the school was built in 1859, but when the school porch was built by J.C. Mansel Pleydell, nephew of the Rev. J. Michael the tablet was removed. The school mistress appointed in 1859 was Mrs. Eliza Virram, assisted by two teachers. Mr. Maidment was appointed as the first School Master in 1868. Milborne School became a first tier school under the re-organisation programme of the 1980's. On leaving Milborne School the children go to Puddletown Middle School then on to Dorchester Upper Schools when 13.
